meanings.definition: Agendums: plural form of agenda, a list or plan of things to be done or considered
meanings.sent1: I always write down my agendums before starting my day.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had a long list of agendums for the class to complete.
meanings.sent3: My cat seems to have its own agendums for when it wants to be fed.
meanings.sent4: The agendums for success include hard work and determination.
meanings.sent5: She carried her agendums with her everywhere, ensuring nothing was forgotten.

meanings.definition: Agendums: items on a list of things to be done or considered
meanings.sent1: The agendums for the meeting were neatly organized on the table.
meanings.sent2: He checked off each of the agendums as he completed them.
meanings.sent3: The agendums on the grocery list seemed to grow longer as she shopped.
meanings.sent4: The agendums in his mind were constantly changing and evolving.
meanings.sent5: She tackled the agendums one by one, feeling accomplished with each task completed.
